location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the volume.The subject 868 (Consular) consists of two volumes, IOR/L/PS/10/30-31. The volumes are divided into 7 parts, with parts 1 and 2 comprising one volume, and parts 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 comprising the second volume.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 207; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The volume comprises two parts discussing consular matters:Part 1 concerns exemptions of Foreign Consular Officers from Imperial and Municipal taxation;Part 2 concerns exemptions of Foreign Consular Officers in India from Customs Duties.The volume comprises two parts: 1 and 2. Each part includes a divider which gives the subject and part numbers, year the subject file was opened, subject heading, and list of correspondence references contained in that part by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.

name.namePart: Government of India, Foreign and Political Department
Secretary of State for India, United Kingdom
